Override display EDID on 10.11 <body> I'm trying to override the EDID on my 10.11.6, Late 2012 MBP for my home-theatre setup attached via a HDMI-miniDP cable; basically for some reason the HDMI handshake fails, and the 5.1-audio-extractor only reports AC3 and DTS in its EDID audio block so I only have stereo output. My other HDMI-capable devices had to be forced to DTS output, but that doesn't work on a Mac... so before shelling out another 40 bucks for an HDMI inline EDID modifier, I want to try out if modifying the EDID actually works and provides 5.1 capability to OS X.  The output from ioreg is (truncated):  precode"DisplayProductID" = 5429 "IODisplayEDID" = &lt;&gt; "DisplayVendorID" = 1138 /code/pre  The decoded interesting part of the EDID is (decoded using edid-decode):  precode  Audio data block     AC-3, max channels 6     Supported sample rates (kHz): 48 44.1 32     Maximum bit rate: 640 kHz     DTS, max channels 7     Supported sample rates (kHz): 48 44.1     Maximum bit rate: 1536 kHz   Speaker allocation data block     Speaker map: FL/FR LFE FC RL/RR RLC/RRC /code/pre  So using AWEDIDEditor, I replaced the DTS block with a LPCM block:  precodeLinear PCM, max channels 6 Supported sample rates (kHz): 48 44.1 32 Supported sample sizes (bits): 16 /code/pre  I put the resulting EDID in hex format and used the template from https://gist.github.com/ejdyksen/8302862 to create this override file:  precode&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?&gt; &lt;!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd"&gt; &lt;plist version="1.0"&gt; &lt;dict&gt;   &lt;key&gt;DisplayProductName&lt;/key&gt;   &lt;string&gt;Display with forced RGB mode (EDID override)&lt;/string&gt;   &lt;key&gt;IODisplayEDID&lt;/key&gt;       &lt;data&gt;&lt;/data&gt;   &lt;key&gt;DisplayVendorID&lt;/key&gt;   &lt;integer&gt;1138&lt;/integer&gt;   &lt;key&gt;DisplayProductID&lt;/key&gt;   &lt;integer&gt;5429&lt;/integer&gt; &lt;/dict&gt; &lt;/plist&gt; /code/pre  I disabled SIP, put the file into code/System/Library/Displays/Contents/Resources/Overrides/DisplayVendorID-1138/DisplayProductID-5429/code and code/System/Library/Displays/Contents/Resources/Overrides/DisplayVendorID-472/DisplayProductID-1535/code, and rebooted the system, but ioreg still shows the "old" EDID and "Audio MIDI Setup" still shows only two speakers.  What am I doing wrong? (If you're wondering why I chose two files: one is with VID/PID in hex and one in int format, the docs didn't say if the file must be named hex or int).  <comment334457> The directory name/filename are supposed to be in HEX. I have the same problem as you mentioned, I pretty much was on the same path as you but no luck :-(
